course.overview: In this 10-week course, students learn to analyze how Lowry uses euphemistic language and dramatic irony to critique totalitarian control. We move beyond plot summary to examine the 'Control Machine'â€”the specific mechanisms this society uses to disguise oppression as perfection.

weeks.skill: Analyzing the Pale Eyes and the Apple as symbols of difference
Contrasting the community's order with Jonas's inner uncertainty
Analyzing the introduction of color and memory
Understanding what Jonas knows that his family does not
Analyzing the pivotal moment of realization (Video analysis)
Tracking the shift from passive acceptance to active rebellion
Formulating a claim about Freedom vs. Security

sample_output.text: Lowry uses the Father's casual tone during the twin's release to create a chilling contrast between his gentle actions and the brutality of infanticide. This euphemistic language reveals how the community has stripped death of its meaning to maintain compliant order.
